basics.name: Wendy Chong
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the Department of Electrical Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2017.

courses: Introduction to Biomedical and Clinical Engineering

work.summary: Designed web application and studied network protocols
highlights: Created a web application using the Meraki API, Flask framework and Python to configure Meraki Switches in bulk
Measured data usage across multiple local school netweoks using Cacti monitoring tool
Automated network processes through practing agile development in writing python scripts
Assisted the Professional Services team in developing test networks and deployment of UC tools
Shadowed network engineers to identify wants and demands of federal and commercial customers while working with OEMs and other professional partners to optimize their networks

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa Student Housing Services
highlights: Created new protocols to ensure proper procedures were carried out
Synchronized with other coordinators to provide a safe and healthy environment for residents
Trained new coordinators in proper community protocols
Studied law and business contracts, specially regarding regulations on loans for companies
Individually worked on searching database for details regarding regulations and protocols
Teamed up with graduate students on searching for new details regarding mandatory control over loans
Established new guidelines on submitting forms to drug companies requesting medications
Gained extensive knowledge on protocols regarding new medications and their uses
Collaborated with drug representatives to ensure that patients get the most updated care loans

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.
